column4: Hello, I'm having some more compilation errors. I've Googled around and it said to install the dev version of gstreamer, and I did... But I'm still getting this error: checking whether pkg-config knows about gstreamer-app-0.10... configure: error: gstreamer-app-0.10.pc not found.. Do you need to set PKG_CONFIG_PATH?" This is when trying "./configure" as a user.
I think you should install some gstreamer's header
I've no idea what that is, heh.
not sure, but I think you should run "sudo apt-get install libgstreamer0.10-dev -" first
I've already done that.
is there anything I'm supposed to do AFTER that?
then, you should search the web for that error, I cant do a web search here, sorry
what prog are you trying to install?
why dont you use the one in Ubuntu Software Center?
because that gives the dependency errors even though I've manually installed all of them.
hmm, just tesst install that app, work fine,
maybe you should change your repo to main server
I do believe it is. Think you could possibly just upload your sources.list for me?
just a min, let me see
here it is
http://pastebin.com/HeL2hKmN
I use the repos of vietnam group, not an official repo...
haha, it work fine for me, since I'm living in Vietnam... ;)
okay, I can't use this. If it's taking this long just to load the list who knows how long it will take to actually download a file. :/
liquidsoap takes less than 10Mb, so if you dont want, you can use the main repos :D
I must have had a conflicting repo, because I made a blank sources.list, added that one repository, and all is well now. :D
:D
haha, all just because of the sources.list? :))
